sentences: Meil oli tore aeg tööst kodus.
context: In Estonian, 'tööst' is an elative case form of the word 'töö', which means 'work'. The elative case indicates movement away from or out of something. So 'tööst' specifically means 'out of work', 'from work', or 'after work' depending on context. It's commonly used when talking about leaving a workplace, finishing work for the day, or coming from work.
